answers.answer: Jenny McCarthy wrote a hilarious pregnancy book on all the not so fun things about pregnancy...

Your boobs are going to get huge and when the baby comes they will get so sore because they are full of milk but after awhile of breastfeeding your boobs get use to it and so do you. Also, make sure to take good care of your teeth, along with gestational diabetes there is also gestational gingivitis. You may get swollen feet and hands and your feet may grow and whole size (my cousins did). It's a roller coaster but so worth it. And not everyone is the same.
your boobs will also start leaking milk
Sore boobs, projectile vomit, ur man will smell horrible, eventually u won't be able to see ur feet... like I could go on for days! Lol!
You pee a little when you sneeze Lol.

There are a lot of things that happen, im 6 weeks and also have plenty of discharge. Not to mention the hunger, sleepyness and constant peeing, back ache is also a problem. The list is endless... just take 1 day at a time.

My back hurts my boobs are sore I am eating like some kind of crazed person my emotions are all over the place I don't want my husband to touch me and I feel like I'm losing my mind all the time and I am only 12 wks.... does it get better?

question: Any stories to tell me of the other MAGICAL things that will happen to my body? Lol! Im 7 weeks
title: All this discharge is so bizarre!
